eu.shooktea.vmsm.module.mysql

Class SqlConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.shooktea.vmsm.module.mysql.SqlConnection

  • public class SqlConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of single connection with database. Creation of instance of connection can be done either by calling contructor or using MySQL.createConnection() method.

    Constructing object alone only load all configuration required for opening connection. To actually use that connection you must call open() first. On the end of using that connection you must call close() to release all resources and, including registered port if SSH tunnelling is used.

    If the connection is open (you can check it with isOpen() method), you can pass single MySQL queries to query(String) method.

      SqlConnection(MySQL sql, VirtualMachine vm)
      Creates new instance of connection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SqlConnection

        public SqlConnection(MySQL sql,
                     VirtualMachine vm)
        Creates new instance of connection. That instance cannot yet accept any queries - you need to call open() first.
        Parameters:
        sql - MySQL module, containing all required configuration for current virtual machine
        vm - current virtual machine

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open()
          throws com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException,
                 java.sql.SQLException
        Opens new connection to database. If SSH tunnelling is used, method registers port. Opening new connection with SSH tunnelling is not possible if one of them is already opened, so you always need to call close() if your connection is no longer needed.
        Throws:
        com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException - if SSH tunnelling failed
        java.sql.SQLException - if connection to database failed
        See Also:
        close()

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Closes connection to database. It is required to close every connection that isn't needed anymore. If connection uses SSH tunnelling then opening new connection is not possible when the previous one is still not closed.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if closing SSH tunnelling failed. It will not be thrown if connection doesn't use SSH tunnelling.
        See Also:
        open()

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Checks if connection is currently open. Connection must be opened before sending queries to MySQL and must be closed when it is no longer needed.
        Returns:
        true if connection is open, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        open(), close()

      • query

        public java.lang.Object query(java.lang.String query)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Sends SQL query to database. If query is a SELECT query then method will return ResultSet with all values returned by database, otherwise method will return Integer with count of updated rows.

        Connection to database must be opened before sending queries to database. When all queries has been sent and connection is no longer needed, it needs to be closed in order to release it's resources.

        Parameters:
        query - SQL query
        Returns:
        result of SQL - either ResultSet or Integer.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if connection is not open yet.
        See Also:
        open(), close()
